title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 30 June 2015 - XWiki
content:

11:03 <lucaa> has quit  
11:15 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:27 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <vmassol> evalica: hi  
11:43 <evalica> vmassol:  hi  
11:43 <vmassol> seems we have some CSS issue on xwiki.org, maybe you could help with this. For example on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki72M1 there are plenty of content using ##something##  
11:43 <vmassol> but it's not displayed differently anymore  
11:44 <vmassol> any idea?  
11:44 <vmassol> for ex here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki72M1#HSpacereferenceinsteadofSpacename  
11:45 <evalica> second  
11:45 <vmassol> I can see <span class="monospace" but the CSS seems off  
11:45 <evalica> yes - seems a but in Flamingo  
11:45 <evalica> we have the style for tt  
11:46 <evalica> I will report it  
11:46 <evalica> and fix  
12:16 <msmeria> hello, devs  
12:17 <msmeria> can someone promote application-piwik-extension v1.1 on http://nexus.xwiki.org/ ?  
12:18 <tmortagne> msmeria: you should have the right to do it  
12:18 <tmortagne> did you try ?  
12:18 <tmortagne> if you can't I will check your rights  
12:19 <msmeria> tmortagne: I've checked the doc from http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HReleasetheproject  
12:19 <msmeria> I don't see any Close button  
12:20 <tmortagne> and now ?  
12:21 <tmortagne> close and release button are above the repositories list  
12:22 <msmeria> yes, I see them now  
12:22 <msmeria> I hope I won't brake anything :P  
12:22 <tmortagne> make sure to use close and release  
12:22 <tmortagne> never use promote  
12:22 <msmeria> break\*  
12:23 <tmortagne> promote will keep the artifact on nexus side only  
12:23 <msmeria> ok  
12:25 <vmassol> if you want to be sure to not break anything, you can try the extension while it's in staging  
12:25 <vmassol> (that's what staging is for normally ;))  
12:26 <vmassol> you need to configure the staging repo in xwiki'c ofnig  
12:26 <vmassol> \*confi  
12:26 <vmassol> \*config  
12:26 <vmassol> and then release it if all is ok  
12:30 <msmeria> vmassol: can't I just test http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/xwiki\_contrib\_staging\_profile-1299/content/org/xwiki/contrib/application-piwik-extension/1.1/application-piwik-extension-1.1.xar without configuring the staging repo?  
12:31 <tmortagne> msmeria: yes you can just import the XAR if you want, vmassol was mentionning testing it as an extension in case you changed some dependencies etc  
12:31 <vmassol> msmeria: you need to tell your XE where to find it  
12:31 <vmassol> to install with EM  
12:32 <vmassol> if your extensions has deps it's eaiser with EM and since EM is what users should use it's best to test it anyway  
12:32 <Trefex> has quit  
12:33 <vmassol> (going for lunch)  
12:33 <msmeria> tmortagne: vmassol: this extension doesn't have any dependencies  
12:40 <vmassol> actually it has but have forgotten to define them ;)  
12:40 <vmassol> (but they're internal deps)  
12:40 <vmassol> since I'm sure you're using some macro, some sheets, etc  
12:41 <vmassol> the best way to find those deps is to write some func tests since the framework contructs a minimal XWiki runtime for you  
12:41 <vmassol> and if you haven't declared what you need then you'll quickly see it  
13:11 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: are you handling http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12256 ? I could work on it since I worked on URLs. Let me know  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: do you agree with the idea?  
13:12 <vmassol> reading it first to understand the problem :)  
13:12 <vmassol> reading  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> it's adding a new method in xwiki.getURL  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> maybe we should add it on a URL script service or something like that  
13:20 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: we discussed this with Enygma`yesterday, IMO what we need is a getURL taking any EntityReference and let it return the right URL for the passed type of entity  
13:21 <gdelhumeau> vmassol is explained me the same thing :)  
13:21 <gdelhumeau> \*explaining  
13:40 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <vmassol> evalica: since you committed in 6.4 branch it means affects should be modified too. Thanks for fixing this!  
13:47 <evalica> k - thanks for reporting  
13:47 <vmassol> would be nice to indicte the issue that broke it  
13:47 <evalica> well :) there is no issue that broke it...  
13:48 <evalica> we never implemented it in Flamingo  
13:48 <vmassol> oh....  
13:48 <evalica> we covered the .code case  
13:48 <evalica> and tt  
13:48 <evalica> not the .monospace  
13:48 <vmassol> strange that I didn't notice it before  
13:48 <vmassol> because I pay attention to this normally  
13:48 <vmassol> 6.4 was not on flamingo yet?  
13:49 <evalica> yes it was …. but I didn't know the rendering adds that class  
13:49 <vmassol> (I didn't notice it on xwiki.org before the upgrade)  
13:49 <evalica> I don't know  
13:49 <vmassol> (and I think xwiki.org was on 6.4.x)  
13:50 <vmassol> ok...  
13:50 <evalica> I had no conflict on 6.4.x … so 6.4.4 didn't had the code  
13:51 <vmassol> maybe it had it in some other place? :)  
13:51 <vmassol> checking quickly on my side on 6.4 final  
13:51 <evalica> k - ty - let me know  
13:51 <vmassol> checking on 6.4.1 since I don't have 6.4.0 locally  
13:52 <vmassol> btw we don't have monospace on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/ ;)  
13:52 <evalica> you need to look in XWikiSyntax  
13:53 <evalica> :)  
13:53 <vmassol> we have a styles section  
13:53 <vmassol> but missing this one  
13:53 <vmassol> FYI it works on 6.4.#  
13:53 <vmassol> 6.4.1  
13:53 <evalica> hmmm  
13:53 <vmassol> I knew I had not dreamed it :)  
13:53 <evalica> second .. than .. to find the regression  
13:54 <vmassol> hmm  
13:54 <vmassol> in the html I have <tt>...  
13:54 <vmassol> so we must have changed from using TT to using <span class="monospave"  
13:54 <vmassol> need to find the commit that did that  
13:55 <gsmeria> has quit  
13:56 <evalica> maybe XRENDERING-392 ?  
13:56 <vmassol> checkgin code  
13:56 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:56 <evalica> XRENDERING-374  
13:57 <vmassol> hmm  
13:57 <vmassol> in the code I see:  
13:57 <vmassol> case MONOSPACE:  
13:57 <vmassol>     getXHTMLWikiPrinter().printXMLStartElement("tt");  
13:57 <evalica> XRENDERING-137 this is the one  
13:57 <vmassol> ah that's why  
13:57 <vmassol> I'm looking at XHTML renderer code  
13:57 <vmassol> ans guillaume added a new HTML5 renderer and changed it there only  
13:58 <vmassol> s/ans/and  
13:58 <vmassol> so indeed it's http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-137 that caused the regression  
13:58 <vmassol> so 6.4M3  
13:59 <vmassol> cool we went to the bottom of it :)  
13:59 <evalica> k :) ty for help  
13:59 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:00 <vmassol> np  
14:00 <vmassol> thanks for fixing it!  
14:00 <evalica> np :)  
14:00 <vmassol> you may want to comment in the CSS  
14:00 <vmassol> since there are 2 ways: TT and SPAN class=onospace  
14:00 <vmassol> \*monospace  
14:01 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <vmassol> one is for the XHTML/HTML 4.01 renderers and the other one is for the XHTML5  
14:01 <vmassol> actually  
14:01 <evalica> well … tt is no longer generated by rendering … so users would need to add it manually  
14:01 <vmassol> I'm wondering  
14:01 <evalica> plus on tt we don't have a certain rule, but we rely on the browser standard  
14:01 <vmassol> if we shouldn't change the XHTML/HTML4 renderers  
14:01 <vmassol> but it may break existing customizations  
14:02 <vmassol> let's leave it like this for now  
14:02 <vmassol> :)

14:37 <OSIMasson> has left #xwiki

14:41 <vmassol> evalica: would it be possible that you fix the monospace on xwiki.org b?  
14:41 <vmassol> s/b/
